info.title: Netatmo
info.description:
Welcome to the Netatmo swagger on-line documentation !

This site is a complement to the official Netatmo developper documentation using swagger to bring interactivity and easy testing of requests with the "try it" button (authenticate with the authorization code OAuth2 flow by clicking the authenticate button in the methods). You can find the source code for this site can be found in the project netatmo-swagger-ui. You can also use the online swagger declaration file to generate code or static documentation (see netatmo-swagger-api).

tags.name: deprecated
tags.description: These methods are no longer maintained nor supported

get.description: Links a callback url to a user.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Your webhook callback url

parameters.name: app_type
parameters.description: Webhooks are only available for Welcome, enter app_camera.

post.description: The method createnewschedule creates a new schedule stored in the backup list.

parameters.name: device_id
parameters.description: The relay id

parameters.name: module_id
parameters.description: The thermostat id

get.description:
The method devicelist returns the list of devices owned by the user, and their modules.
A device is identified by its _id (which is its mac address) and each device may have one, several or no modules, also identified by an _id.

parameters.name: app_type
parameters.description: Defines which device type will be returned by devicelist. It could be app_thermostat or app_station (by default if not provided)

parameters.name: device_id
parameters.description: Specify a device_id if you want to retrieve only this device informations.

parameters.name: get_favorites
parameters.description: When set to "true", the favorite devices of the user are returned. This flag is available only if the devices requested are Weather Stations.

get.description: Dissociates a webhook from a user.

parameters.name: app_type
parameters.description: For Welcome, use app_camera

get.description: Returns the snapshot associated to an event.

parameters.name: image_id
parameters.description: id of the image (can be retrieved as 'id' in 'face' in Gethomedata, or as 'id' in 'snapshot' in Getnextevents, Getlasteventof and Geteventsuntil)

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Security key to access snapshots.

get.description: Returns the snapshot associated to an event.

parameters.name: home_id
parameters.description: ID of the Home you're interested in

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: Your request will retrieve all the events until this one

get.description: The method gethomecoachsdata Returns data from a user Healthy Home Coach Station (measures and device specific data).

parameters.name: device_id
parameters.description: Id of the device you want to retrieve information of

get.description: Returns information about users homes and cameras.

parameters.name: home_id
parameters.description: Specify if you're looking for the events of a specific Home.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Number of events to retrieve. Default is `30`.

parameters.name: home_id
parameters.description: ID of the Home you're interested in

parameters.name: person_id
parameters.description: Your request will retrieve all events of the given home until the most recent event of the given person

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of events to retrieve. Default is 30.

get.description: The method getmeasure returns the measurements of a device or a module.

parameters.name: device_id
parameters.description: Id of the device whose module's measurements you want to retrieve. This _id can be found in the user's devices field.

parameters.name: module_id
parameters.description: If you don't specify any module_id you will retrieve the device's measurements. If you specify a module_id you will retrieve the module's measurements.

parameters.name: scale
parameters.description:
Defines the time interval between two measurements.
Possible values :
max -> every value stored will be returned
30min -> 1 value every 30 minutes
1hour -> 1 value every hour
3hours -> 1 value every 3 hours
1day -> 1 value per day
1week -> 1 value per week
1month -> 1 value per month

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Measures you are interested in. Data you can request depends on the scale.
**For Weather Station:**
  * max -> Temperature (°C), CO2 (ppm), Humidity (%), Pressure (mbar), Noise (db), Rain (mm), WindStrength (km/h), WindAngle (angles), Guststrength (km/h), GustAngle (angles)
  * 30min, 1hour, 3hours -> Same as above + min_temp, max_temp, min_hum, max_hum, min_pressure, max_pressure, min_noise, max_noise, sum_rain, date_max_gust
  * 1day, 1week, 1month -> Same as above + date_min_temp, date_max_temp, date_min_hum, date_max_hum, date_min_pressure, date_max_pressure, date_min_noise, date_max_noise, date_min_co2, date_max_co2

**For Thermostat:**
  * max -> temperature (°C), sp_temperature (°C), boileron (sec), boileroff (sec)
  * 30min, 1hour, 3hours -> temperature, sp_temperature, min_temp,
max_temp, sum_boiler_on, sum_boiler_off
  * 1day, 1week, 1month -> temperature, min_temp, date_min_temp,
max_temp, sum_boiler_on, sum_boiler_off

parameters.name: date_begin
parameters.description:
Starting timestamp (utc) of the requested measurements.
Please note measurement retrieving is limited to 1024 measurements.

parameters.name: date_end
parameters.description:
Ending timestamp (utc) of the request measurements.
If you want only the last measurement, do not provide date_begin, and set date_end to `last`.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limits the number of measurements returned (default & max is 1024)

parameters.name: optimize
parameters.description:
Allows you to choose the format of the answer.
If you build a mobile app and bandwith usage is an issue, use `optimize = true`.
Use `optimize = false`, for an easier parse. In this case, values are indexed by sorted timestamp.
Example of un-optimized response :
```json
{"status": "ok", 
  "body": {
    "1347575400": [18.3,39],
    "1347586200": [20.6,48]
  },
"time_exec": 0.012136936187744}
```
If optimize is set true, measurements are returned as an array of series of regularly spaced measurements. Each series is defined by a beginning time beg_time and a step between measurements, step_time:
```json
{"status": "ok",
  "body": [
    {"beg_time": 1347575400,
     "step_time": 10800,
     "value": 
        [[18.3,39],
        [ 20.6,48]]
    }],
"time_exec": 0.014238119125366}
```
Default value is `true`.

parameters.name: real_time
parameters.description:
In scales higher than max, since the data is aggregated, the timestamps returned are by default offset by +(scale/2).
For instance, if you ask for measurements at a daily scale, you will receive data timestamped at 12:00 if real_time is set to `false` (default case), and timestamped at 00:00 if real_time is set to `true`.
NB : The servers always store data with real_time set to `true` and data are offset by this parameter AFTER having being time-filtered, thus you could have data after date_end if real_time is set to `false`.

parameters.name: home_id
parameters.description: ID of the Home you're interested in

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: Your request will retrieve events occured before this one

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Number of events to retrieve. Default is 30.

get.description: Retrieves publicly shared weather data from Outdoor Modules within a predefined area.

parameters.name: lat_ne
parameters.description: Latitude of the north east corner of the requested area. -85 <= lat_ne <= 85 and lat_ne>lat_sw

parameters.name: lon_ne
parameters.description: Longitude of the north east corner of the requested area. -180 <= lon_ne <= 180 and lon_ne>lon_sw

parameters.name: lat_sw
parameters.description: Latitude of the south west corner of the requested area. -85 <= lat_sw <= 85

parameters.name: lon_sw
parameters.description: Longitude of the south west corner of the requested area. -180 <= lon_sw <= 180

parameters.name: required_data
parameters.description: To filter stations based on relevant measurements you want (e.g. rain will only return stations with rain gauges). Default is no filter. You can find all measurements available on the Thermostat page.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: True to exclude stations with abnormal temperature measures. Default is false.

get.description: The method getstationsdata Returns data from a user's Weather Stations (measures and device specific data).

parameters.name: device_id
parameters.description: Id of the device you want to retrieve information of

parameters.name: get_favorites
parameters.description: Whether to include the user's favorite Weather Stations in addition to the user's own Weather Stations

get.description: The method getthermostatsdata returns information about user's thermostats such as their last measurements.

parameters.name: device_id
parameters.description: Id of the device you want to retrieve information of

get.description: The method getthermstate returns the last Thermostat measurements, its current weekly schedule, and, if present, its current manual temperature setpoint.

parameters.name: device_id
parameters.description: The relay id

parameters.name: module_id
parameters.description: The thermostat id

get.description: The method getuser returns information about a user such as prefered language, prefered units, and list of devices.
The method partnerdevices returns the list of device_id to which your partner application has access to.

post.description: Sets a person as 'Away' or the Home as 'Empty'. The event will be added to the user’s timeline.

parameters.name: home_id
parameters.description: ID of the Home you're interested in

parameters.name: person_id
parameters.description: If a person_id is specified, that person will be set as 'Away'. If no person_id is specified, the Home will be set as 'Empty'.

parameters.name: home_id
parameters.description: ID of the Home you're interested in

parameters.name: person_ids
parameters.description: List of persons IDs

post.description: The method setthermpoint changes the Thermostat manual temperature setpoint.

parameters.name: device_id
parameters.description: The relay id

parameters.name: module_id
parameters.description: The thermostat id

parameters.name: setpoint_mode
parameters.description: Chosen setpoint_mode

parameters.name: setpoint_endtime
parameters.description: When using the manual or max setpoint_mode, this parameter defines when the setpoint expires.

parameters.name: setpoint_temp
parameters.description: When using the manual setpoint_mode, this parameter defines the temperature setpoint (in Celcius) to use.

post.description: The method switchschedule switches the Thermostat's schedule to another existing schedule.

parameters.name: device_id
parameters.description: The relay id

parameters.name: module_id
parameters.description: The thermostat id

parameters.name: schedule_id
parameters.description: The schedule id. It can be found in the getthermstate response, under the keys `therm_program_backup` and `therm_program`.

post.description: The method syncschedule changes the Thermostat weekly schedule.

parameters.name: device_id
parameters.description: The relay id

parameters.name: module_id
parameters.description: The thermostat id

requestBody.description: The thermostat program (zones, timetable and name)

GustAngle.description: Direction of the last 5 min highest gust wind

GustStrength.description: Speed of the last 5 min highest gust wind

Pressure.description: Last Sea level pressure measured @ time_utc (in mb)

WindAngle.description: Current 5 min average wind direction measured @ time_utc (in °)

WindStrength.description: Current 5 min average wind speed measured @ time_utc (in km/h)

date_max_temp.description: Timestamp when max temperature was measured

date_max_wind_str.description: Timestamp when max wind strength was measured

date_min_temp.description: Timestamp when min temperature was measured

health_idx.description: Current health index: 0 = Healthy, 1 = Fine, 2 = Fair, 3 = Poor, 4 = Unhealthy

max_temp.description: Min temperature of the day (measured @ date_min_temp)

min_temp.description: Max temperature of the day (measured @ date_max_temp)

sum_rain_1.description: Amount of rain in last hour

modules.description: It lists which modules are linked with this device

type.description:
Included in every device or module. It defines the type of the device/module. Its values are among :
NAMain : for the base station
NAModule1 : for the outdoor module
NAModule4 : for the additionnal indoor module
NAModule3 : for the rain gauge module
NAPlug : for the thermostat relay/plug
NATherm1 : for the thermostat module

wifi_status.description:
It contains the current wifi status. The different thresholds to take into account are
RSSI_THRESHOLD_0 = 86 bad signal
RSSI_THRESHOLD_1 = 71 middle quality signal
RSSI_THRESHOLD_2 = 56 good signal

type.description:
Included in every device or module. It defines the type of the device/module. Its values are among :
NHC: Healthy Home Coach

wifi_status.description:
It contains the current wifi status. The different thresholds to take into account are
RSSI_THRESHOLD_0 = 86 bad signal
RSSI_THRESHOLD_1 = 71 middle quality signal
RSSI_THRESHOLD_2 = 56 good signal

favorite.description: true when the device is a user favorite and not owned by them

reachable.description: true when the station was seen by the Netatmo cloud within the last 4 hours

read_only.description: true when the user was invited to (or has favorited) a station, false when the user owns it

type.description:
Included in every device or module. It defines the type of the device/module. Its values are among :
NAMain : for the base station
NAModule1 : for the outdoor module
NAModule4 : for the additionnal indoor module
NAModule3 : for the rain gauge module
NAPlug : for the thermostat relay/plug
NATherm1 : for the thermostat module

wifi_status.description:
It contains the current wifi status. The different thresholds to take into account are
RSSI_THRESHOLD_0 = 86 bad signal
RSSI_THRESHOLD_1 = 71 middle quality signal
RSSI_THRESHOLD_2 = 56 good signal

battery_percent.description: It contains the current battery level in percentage.

battery_vp.description:
It contains the current battery status. The threshold depends on the kind of module, below is the list of the different threshold to take into account according the module type.
"Indoor module Battery range: 6000 ... 4200" |
INDOOR_BATTERY_LEVEL_FULL = 5640
INDOOR_BATTERY_LEVEL_HIGH = 5280
INDOOR_BATTERY_LEVEL_MEDIUM = 4920
INDOOR_BATTERY_LEVEL_LOW = 4560
"Below 4560: very low" |
    
"Raingauge and outdoor module Battery range: 6000 ... 3600" |
BATTERY_LEVEL_FULL = 5500
BATTERY_LEVEL_HIGH = 5000
BATTERY_LEVEL_MEDIUM = 4500
BATTERY_LEVEL_LOW = 4000
"Below 4000: very low" |
    
"Thermostat Battery range: 4500 ... 3000" |
THERMOSTAT_BATTERY_LEVEL_FULL = 4100
THERMOSTAT_BATTERY_LEVEL_HIGH = 3600
THERMOSTAT_BATTERY_LEVEL_MEDIUM = 3300
THERMOSTAT_BATTERY_LEVEL_LOW = 3000
"Below 3000: very low"

rf_status.description:
"It contains the current radio status. The different thresholds to take into account are :" |
RADIO_THRESHOLD_SIGNAL_LOW = 90 
RADIO_THRESHOLD_SIGNAL_MEDIUM = 80
RADIO_THRESHOLD_SIGNAL_HIGH = 70
RADIO_THRESHOLD_SIGNAL_FULL = 60

type.description:
Included in every device or module. It defines the type of the device/module. Its values are among :
NAMain : for the base station
NAModule1 : for the outdoor module
NAModule4 : for the additionnal indoor module
NAModule3 : for the rain gauge module
NAPlug : for the thermostat relay/plug
NATherm1 : for the thermostat module

setpoint_history.description: The last 20 setpoints (mode, endtime, and timestamp) the thermostats has entered.

therm_program_list.description: List of the weekly heating planning used by the thermostat

type.description:
Included in every device or module. It defines the type of the device/module. Its values are among :
NAMain : for the base station
NAModule1 : for the outdoor module
NAModule4 : for the additionnal indoor module
NAModule3 : for the rain gauge module
NAPlug : for the thermostat relay/plug
NATherm1 : for the thermostat module

devices.description: An array of string containing the ids of the devices owned by the user

friend_devices.description: An array of string containing the ids of the devices on which the user has a "guest" access

feel_like_algo.description: algorithm used to compute feel like temperature, 0 -> humidex, 1 -> heat-index

reg_locale.description: user regional preferences (used for displaying date)

is_local.description: Only for scope access_camera. If Camera and application requesting the information are on the same IP (true/false)

sd_status.description: If SD card status is ok (on/off)

vpn_url.description: Only for scope access_camera. Address of the camera

is_arrival.description: If person was considered away before being seen during this event

person_id.description: Id of the person the event is about (if any)

sub_type.description: Subtypes of SD and Alim events. Go to Welcome page for further details.

type.description: Type of events. Go to the Welcome page for further details.

video_status.description: Status of the video (recording, deleted or available)

key.description: Key for this face to use in getcamerapicture.

version.description: Version of the face if user changed their photo.

last_activity.description: Timestamp of last move detected by the module

name.description: name of the module (given by the user)

last_seen.description: Time at which the person was last seen.

out_of_sight.description: True if the Person is out of sight.

pseudo.description: Name of the person, if pseudo is missing, person is unknown.

time.description: Time of occurence of the sub event

reg_locale.description: user regional preferences (used for displaying date)
